summary: Mary Susan Grimes was an employee of the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents primarily consist of payroll records and certifications spanning from January 1977 to December 1978, indicating her employment during that period. These records detail her salary and position within the committee. One document also mentions background checks conducted on HSCA staff, suggesting she was subject to such checks as part of her employment. The documents do not provide specific details about her role in the JFK assassination investigation, but her presence on the HSCA payroll indicates she was involved in the committee's operations.
significance: Mary Susan Grimes' significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, indicating her involvement in the committee's operations during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of her role is not detailed, her payroll records and background check information suggest she was a staff member contributing to the committee's work.
